meanings.sent1: She resealed the envelope after adding the letter.
meanings.sent2: He always resealed the food containers to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent3: The detective resealed the evidence bag to keep the clues safe.
meanings.sent4: The magician resealed the torn paper with a flick of his wand.
meanings.sent5: The explorer resealed the map to protect it from the rain.

meanings.definition: Close (an envelope, package, etc.) securely again.
meanings.sent1: After checking the contents, she resealed the package.
meanings.sent2: He resealed the box before handing it over to the courier.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resealed the nut in a tiny envelope for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The chef resealed the jar of spices to lock in the freshness.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut resealed the airlock to maintain the pressure inside.
